lines.text: Sue Ellen, have you ever had a 48 hour orgasm?
No, I've never been to Santa Barbara.
[after being told to do the dishes, and using them as clay pigeons]
Dishes are DONE, man.
Why don't you go on home, have a glass of wine and put some cucumber slices on your eyes, you'll feel much better.
Well, I'm all out of cucumbers.
Sue Ellen, every girl over twenty-five should have a cucumber in the house.
[repeated line]
I'm right on top of that Rose.
You guys spent over $3,000 of the company's petty cash?

[sheepishly]
Uh... yeah.
You're grounded! Until Mom returns, you are ALL grounded! How could you steal from me? You never would have stolen money from Mom!
That's because Mom never had that much.
Now, wait a minute, Swell. They didn't steal. They "borrowed". They were following your irresponsibility.
Oh, shut up Kenny! I am in deep shit here!
Then quit your job. You were never good at it anyway.
I can't quit now. I'm an embezzler. I am officially an embezzler! Rose or someone is gonna find that money gone and when they do, they'll lock me up and throw away the key!
Nah, the judge will probably go easy on you considering that you're a minor.
Where is Carolyn?
Mouse brown hair, gives you a headache? Talks like she's chewing her face?
That's her.
[standing in front of Mrs. Sturak's unmarked grave]
I'm gonna miss her.
Miss her? You never even knew her! We never knew her name.
Yeah, but she left us all that money in her clothes, right?
I guess. Oh, well. Hey, you wanna go to Vegas again this weekend?
Sure. You got any more money left?

[at the hospital with a broken leg]
I fell off the roof!

[glares at Kenny]
What was he doing on the roof, Kenny?

I don't know, I wasn't with him, but I should've been! I mean not on the roof, but I should've been keeping an eye on him, spending quality time with him, reading Green Ham and Eggs to him or some shit like that.

[about Kenny]
Is he your son too?
No, he's my stepson.
Yeah, that's why we don't always get along.
[last lines]
Where is the babysitter?
Go get that tape measure thing out of the garage.
Will you stop ordering us around? You're not the babysitter.
That's right, Kenny. The babysitter is dead. So just do it!
She doesn't look dead.
That's because it just happened. So you can't really tell, like on "MacGyver".
We told you to talk to her. We didn't want you to send her to the glue factory.
I didn't kill her, Zach. She died in her sleep.
Probably choked on her whistle.
This place is a crock! We're never gonna make it through the summer. Man, I'm gonna hold up at Lizard's.
Oh, that's real brotherly of you Kenny. Always taking the easy way out. Don't you have any pride?
No.
I got an idea. When our food runs out, we can eat Elvis.
[the dog Elvis runs out of the room]
Time for little boys to be in bed.
Can't you see I'm in the middle of a date?

[Opening the car door and tossing Cynthia out]
And time for little trollops to go home!

[searching the house for the money]
She must've had it on her!
Well it's ours! Go back and get it from the old hag!
Oh yeah, we'll just go down there and say "excuse me, we left our money on dead baby sitter". No way!
You promised to sign me up for baseball.
Little League will be there next year.
So will Australia.
Melissa, want to get down from there?
No.
Get down from there.

[after pot plant falls off window sill]
Fuck!
You have a lot of deliveries today?
I am the stork of fast food.
Don't feel overwhelmed, just do one thing at a time.
Um... what should we do with her body?
Call an ambulance, call the cops, I don't know. Well... I mean they're gonna come and get her and they're gonna ask us a lotta questions...
They'll probably blame us.

[scared of the thought]
They'll definitely call Mom!
SHE'LL blame us.
Yeah, she'll hop the next flight home and then be in our faces.
I don't want Mom to come home.
I don't either.
No way.
Me too.
We have to get up at the butt-crack of dawn to tidy up the garage!

[catching Zach taking money from her wallet]
Zach! Put it back. If you need money, ask first.
Okay then, can I have ten dollars?
Forget it!
Cynthia, you're my moon goddess.
[picking up phone and shouting]
What?
[pause]
Oh, how ya doin Mom? Yeah, no everythings fine. No, Mrs. Sturak's not here. She um, she went to the yarn store. Yeah, she's crocheting this massive doily for the couch! I... I gotta go Mom.
T.V. rots your brains.
Did you burn something?
Yeah, well, maybe if you'd called and told me you were gonna be, like... three-and-a-half hours late, I could've planned my dinner better.
I had to work late, OK?
You still should've called. I sat and I waited. I went ahead and I fed the kids. I worked all day on that casserole.
Sorry.

You haven't even said how nice the house looks. You're off at the office all day doing interesting office things. I'm stuck here cooking and cleaning and mowing the lawn, helping Melissa with her fastball, being a role model for Zach, spending quality time with Walter, doing your party shit! You've got the car and you don't even take me anywhere anymore. And when was the last time we went out to dinner together, huh? You know what, I'm sick and tired of not being appreciated!
I appreciate you.
Eat shit!
[storms away]

30 every morning so I can beat rush hour traffic into the city and go sit behind a desk for eight hours a day and miss Oprah Winfrey everyday on my summer vacation. And then, I get to drive home in gridlock IN A VOLVO with no air conditioning just so I can take care of you guys and put food on the damn table! It's a rat race and it sucks, Kenny. So what do you want, a medal?
[long pause]
Oh come on, you don't have to do all this. I mean, I never asked you to whisk the couch.
Well, it needed it.
I feel so guilty, I should've been nicer.
Yeah, she was a great baby sitter.
One of us has to get a job.
Well I'm not gonna.
Well we don't have a choice. We'll flip for it
[takes out a fozen pizza]
Mama Celeste face up, I go to work, Mama Celeste face down, we're selling carnations on a freeway off ramp.
It was petty cash, YOU were spending petty cash.
Zach, I bought a pair of boots and a magazine, you bought a home entertainment center!
Don't you ever go outside?
Nope, no TV, and no prizes.
I am NOT working at the big top from hell for pocket money. My mom's away and I have my brothers and sister to take care of and nobody's going to hire a kid to do anything that's not disgusting.
What are we going to do for cash for the next two months?
What about a garage sale?
We live in the boonies.
What about calling Dad?
Dad doesn't care.
What about blackmailing Dad?
What about donating blood? Don't they pay you for that?
You have to be over 18.
Well, there goes our great summer.
What do you want from me? You want me to call Mom back? Because I can.
No.
You want to call Aunt Pat or go crawling to one of Mom's semi-wretched friends?
No!
Alright. We don't need a warden, we don't need somebody telling us when to eat and sleep and vacuum. We can still have a great summer, we just have to work together.

[to Sue Ellen about their mom]
Stay away from her, she's in one of her Terminator moods.

[Kenny serves burnt black Belgian waffles]
Doesn't look like Julia's.
Shut up, quizzoid, and eat.

Look, we are a family of felons. Our summer freedom's going to be a winter prison unless I get some help around here. I want the house spick-and-span by Saturday night or I'm turning us all in. Are you with me?
Guys, what do you say?
Yeah.
Yeah? Come on, guys, what do you say?
YEAH!
YEAH! We're with you, Sue, ROCK AND ROLL!
Not exactly your dream job, eh?
Got that right. You think I woke up this morning and said, 'Gee, I'd love to scrub fat vats! I'd love to smile and work with raw meat'?
I'd respect your privacy more if you weren't so secretive.
Well I'd tell you more if you didn't want to know so much.
You couldn't even mow the lawn today, you're worthless! I am doing EVERYTHING around here AND I'm trying to get ready for a date. When are you going to start helping me you lazy little punk?
[slams door]
Kenny, get back here, RIGHT NOW!

[in the back of his friends' pickup]
I'll do it later, Mom, I promise!
Isn't your mom leaving for like, months?
Oh shit, you're right.
[hollers back]
BYE MOM, HAVE A BLAST!

[dryly]
Right.

[hand signs]
ROCK AND ROLL!

[watching a game show, trying to guess the answer]
Alaska... Alaska... Alaska container... Alaska... spill.
[Mrs Sturak turns the TV off]
Hey! I was watching that!
TV rots your brains!
[picks up first volume of the encyclopedia and tosses it to Walter]
Go to your room! I expect a complete report tomorrow morning on the life of the aardvark!
How come you gotta go?
Because, I have had a very rough 37 years, and I need a break.
You promised you'd sign me up for baseball!
Little League will be there next year.
So will Australia! I wish Dad was around.
No you don't.
When our food is gone, we can eat Elvis!
[dog whimpers and leaves the room]
Melissa, it was your turn to take out the trash this week.
Well I couldn't fit it into my schedule.
Park it yourself, Metallica breath!
River Ridge Hospital is on line for you, it seems there's been an emergency with your son.
Oh!... My son!
Your son?
Your son?
